          performance.mark('gtm.start');
          (function (w, d, s, l, i) {
            w[l] = w[l] || [];
            w[l].push({ 'gtm.start': new Date().getTime(), event: 'gtm.js' });
            var f = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0],
                j = d.createElement(s),
                dl = l != 'dataLayer' ? '&l=' + l : '';
            j.async = true;
            j.src = 'https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtm.js?id=' + i + dl;
            j.onload = function () {
              performance.mark('gtm.end');
              performance.measure('gtm', 'gtm.start', 'gtm.end');
            };
            f.parentNode.insertBefore(j, f);
        })(window, document, 'script', 'dataLayer', 'GTM-M36RG8PT');

It highlights key developments in the Russian cybercrime market, including the emergence of new trojans and sophisticated attack strategies leveraging social engineering. class="metadata Metadata_root__EZem9" data-cy="metadata"><h1 class="title Metadata_title__aM3nZ Heading_h1__jLBB4 Heading_heading___M8rU">Hi-Tech Crime Trends 2016</h1><div class="stats Stats_root__p_BoZ"><span class="text Text_root__RtCPC Text_medium__TH6gG Text_secondary__o6d_E Likes_root__WVQ1_" style="-webkit-line-clamp:0" tabindex="0">2 likes</span><span class="Stats_bullet__DbT30"></span><span class="text Text_root__RtCPC Text_medium__TH6gG Text_secondary__o6d_E Likes_root__WVQ1_" style="-webkit-line-clamp:0" tabindex="0">1,003<!-- --> <!-- -->views</span><button type="button" class="ai-tag unstyled-button AITag_tag__Xx37c" data-cy="ai-tag" aria-describedby="aiTag-description" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rl29r6:" popovertarget=":Rl29r6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rl29r6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:20px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG"><span class="Icon_mask__bniyY" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/sparkles.944c3fba.svg)"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></span>AI-enhanced description</button><div class="" id=":Rl29r6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rl29r6"></div></div><div class="author Author_root___6Bx5"><a data-cy="author-link" class="Author_link___lVxw ellipsis" title="Group-IB" href="https://www.slideshare.net/Group-IB"><div class="Avatar_root__GNWHY" style="width:24px;height:24px;line-height:24px"><img class="Avatar_image__Bbtll" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/profile-photo-Group-IB-48x48.jpg?cb=1523415001" alt="Group-IB" loading="lazy" decoding="sync"/></div><span>Group-IB</span></a></div><div class="description Description_root__kt4uq Description_clamped__PaV_1"><div class="Description_wrapper__hYE9_"><p data-cy="document-description">The document reviews hi-tech crime trends from Q2 2015 to Q1 2016, focusing on the rise of targeted attacks on banks, the expansion of the Android trojan market, and the increasing threat of ransomware and attacks on critical infrastructure. It highlights key developments in the Russian cybercrime market, including the emergence of new trojans and sophisticated attack strategies leveraging social engineering. The report concludes with recommendations for prevention and response measures against these evolving cyber threats.</p><div class="pills-list PillsList_root__2EydN"><a class="Pill_root__IqOYH" aria-label="View the featured presentations, documents and infographics in the Technology Category" href="https://www.slideshare.net/category/technology"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv ATMs and SWIFT
TREND NO.2
GROUPS REFOCUS FROM COMPANIES TO BANKS

Core Banking Systems
CORKOW
POS terminals, ATMs,
trading terminals
ANUNAK
Core Banking Systems,
SWIFT, ATMs,
payment gateways,
POS terminals

 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/85/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-4-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/85/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-4-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/75/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-4-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/85/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-4-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide5" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:1024 / 768" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-4" alt="FORECAST
TARGETED ATTACKS ON BANKS
CHANGE IN
FOCUS
Active groups
specializing in attacks
on companies will
threaten banks
EXPANDING IN
GEOGRAPHY
Hackers attacking Russian
banks will move their
activity to other regions
worldwide
BROADENING
COMPETENCIES
Groups attacking ATMs will
perform cyber thefts on
SWIFT system
PHISHING
MAILOUTS
The key vector to infect
banking networks is
phishing emails
INVOLVING
INSIDERS
Hackers devote more
time searching for
insiders (contacts,
application launch,
consulting on system
operation)
LEGITIMATE
TOOLS
Criminals choose
legitimate or free tools to
perform attacks
Arrests of Russian-speaking hacker groups
have a significant impact on
the global landscape of banking threats
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/85/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-5-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/85/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-5-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/75/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-5-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/gib-en-170330162103/85/Hi-Tech-Crime-Trends-2016-5-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide6" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:1024 / 768" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-5" alt="TREND NO.3
Russian-speaking PC Trojan
developers take over the world
GLOBE
Panda Banker (new)
Shifu (new)
Midas bot (Jupiter) (new)
GozNym (new)
Sphinx (new)
Corebot (new)
Atmos (new)
Gozi (ISFB)

Citadel
Zeus
Quakbot (Qbot)

Ramnit
RUSSIA
Buhtrap
Toplel
Ranbyus
RTM (new)
Jupiter (new)
Lurk
Corkow
Yebot
Kronos
Chtonic
16 of the 19 Trojans that have been actively used to
attack companies are believed to be developed by
Russian-speaking cybercriminals
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM

over the world
CONTRACTION OF
THE RUSSIAN
MARKET
The amount of groups,
Trojans and losses from
attacks will continuously
decrease
MOVEMENT TO
NEW MARKETS
New Trojans designed
to attack foreign banks
will be actively
developed
HACKERS TO
SELL ACTIVE
BOTNETS
Some active botnets will be
sold to less-experienced
perpetrators
WEB INJECTS
Developers will add web
injects to perform
automated attacks
FAKE WEB PAGES
Fake web pages added to
Trojans will enable hackers
to expand the list of
attacked countries
SPAM MAILOUTS
The key infection vector
for banking Trojans

companies

functionality

successfully performed on

to BANKS

AUTOMATED FRAUD
Automatic fraud on
ANDROID
Criminals will attack both
companies and people
using web injects to
replace payment details.
ROBOT-BASED
VISHING
Automated vishing attacks
will be adjusted to bypass
SMS verification and will
become more popular
AUTOMATED
PHISHING
The function to bypass
SMS verification will make
mobile Trojans the most
dangerous threat to the
majority of banks.
With their wide distribution and automation
PHISHING and ANDROID Trojans will finally replace PC
Trojans.

BOTNETS FOR DDOS ATTACKS

AMPLIFIERS

CharGen and other types
are less actively used

REAPPEAR

servers and simple IoT
devices to create botnets
SOURCE CODES
ARE PUBLISHED
Lizard Stresser and Mirai
were released publicly
Dynamic IP addresses
No antivirus installed
24-hours access to the Internet
IoT devices are perfect bots
Difficult to update and eliminate
known vulnerabilities
Passwords set by default

450 Gbps

INCREASE IN INCIDENTS WITH RANSOMWARE
Wide variety of
targets
Mobile and IoT devices,
cloud storages
Average ransom will
increase
Newer ransomware versions
will deliberately target key
business assets, which will
significantly raise the price of
ransomware decryption keys
Pinpoint attack
The key target is companies
with critical business
processes, which cannot
spend time to recover them
and will pay ransoms
Worms
Ransomware will be
distributed as
cryptoworms to widely
spread threats and
cause significant
damage
Smoke Screens
Encrypting ransomware will
be used as a “distraction”
tool in conjunction with high-
profile targeted attacks, like
DDoS attacks used
previously
An increase in attacks will
stimulate the cyber risk
insurance segment, which in
turn will motivate criminals
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM

ATTACKS ON CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE
Public
information
Information on
successful attacks will
leak to journalists
because of their
political subtext
Popularization
Public reaction to
successful attacks will
provoke increased interest
from cyber-armies and
terrorists
Cyber-armies
Cyber-armies will attack
critical infrastructure
facilities
Goal: espionage and
control capability
Terrorists
Cyber-terrorists will
target critical
infrastructure facilities
Goal: public attention,
human losses
ONLINE
RECRUITMENT
Cyber-terrorists will
actively use the Internet
for propagation and
recruitments of technical
specialists, who are able
to perform targeted
attacks
arrests
and recruitment
Hackers arrested for
targeted attacks on
companies will be
recruited by the
Government

style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG"><span class="Icon_mask__bniyY" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/file.d43bb72d.svg)"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></span>Hi-Tech Crime Trends 2016</h2><div><ul class="Transcript_list__faItj"><div><li>1. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#1">2015 Q2 –
2016 </a> Q1
HI-TECH
CRIME TRENDS
2016
 </li></div><div><li>2. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#2">Review of the </a> Russian cybercrime market
Key driver of growth – Targeted attacks
Changes to previous period
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>3. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#3">TREND No.1
TARGETED ATTACKS </a> ON BANKS AS A GLOBAL THREAT
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>4. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#4">COBALT
ATMs and SWIFT
TREND </a> NO.2
GROUPS REFOCUS FROM COMPANIES TO BANKS
LURK
Core Banking Systems
CORKOW
POS terminals, ATMs,
trading terminals
ANUNAK
Core Banking Systems,
SWIFT, ATMs,
payment gateways,
POS terminals
BUHTRAP
Core Banking Systems
GROUP-IB.COM/REPORTS
CURRENT
soon!
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>5. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#5">FORECAST
TARGETED ATTACKS ON </a> BANKS
CHANGE IN
FOCUS
Active groups
specializing in attacks
on companies will
threaten banks
EXPANDING IN
GEOGRAPHY
Hackers attacking Russian
banks will move their
activity to other regions
worldwide
BROADENING
COMPETENCIES
Groups attacking ATMs will
perform cyber thefts on
SWIFT system
PHISHING
MAILOUTS
The key vector to infect
banking networks is
phishing emails
INVOLVING
INSIDERS
Hackers devote more
time searching for
insiders (contacts,
application launch,
consulting on system
operation)
LEGITIMATE
TOOLS
Criminals choose
legitimate or free tools to
perform attacks
Arrests of Russian-speaking hacker groups
have a significant impact on
the global landscape of banking threats
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>6. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#6">TREND NO.3
Russian-speaking PC </a> Trojan
developers take over the world
GLOBE
Panda Banker (new)
Shifu (new)
Midas bot (Jupiter) (new)
GozNym (new)
Sphinx (new)
Corebot (new)
Atmos (new)
Gozi (ISFB)
Dridex
Qadars
Gootkit
Vawtrak
Tinba
KINS (ZeusVM)
Citadel
Zeus
Quakbot (Qbot)
Retefe
Ramnit
RUSSIA
Buhtrap
Toplel
Ranbyus
RTM (new)
Jupiter (new)
Lurk
Corkow
Yebot
Kronos
Chtonic
16 of the 19 Trojans that have been actively used to
attack companies are believed to be developed by
Russian-speaking cybercriminals
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>7. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#7">FORECAST
Russian-speaking PC Trojan </a> developers take
over the world
CONTRACTION OF
THE RUSSIAN
MARKET
The amount of groups,
Trojans and losses from
attacks will continuously
decrease
MOVEMENT TO
NEW MARKETS
New Trojans designed
to attack foreign banks
will be actively
developed
HACKERS TO
SELL ACTIVE
BOTNETS
Some active botnets will be
sold to less-experienced
perpetrators
WEB INJECTS
Developers will add web
injects to perform
automated attacks
FAKE WEB PAGES
Fake web pages added to
Trojans will enable hackers
to expand the list of
attacked countries
SPAM MAILOUTS
The key infection vector
for banking Trojans
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>8. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#8">TREND NO.4
ANDROID TROJAN </a> MARKET IS EXPANDING QUICKLY
EUROPE AND
USA
Marcher 2.0 (new)
Xbot (new)
Abrvall (new)
Asacub (new)
Mbot 2.0 (new)
T00rb00r (new)
Marcher
GM-bot
Skunk
Bilal
Reich (Svpeng)
RUSSIA
Group 404
ApiMaps
Adabot
Cron1 (new)
FlexNet (new)
Agent.sx (new)
Agent.BID (new)
Honli (new)
Asucub (new)
FakeInst.ft (new)
GM bot (new)
Fake Marcher (new)
Cron2 (new)
Greff
March
Webmobil
Mikorta
MobiApps
Xruss
Tark
Sizeprofit
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>9. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#9">TREND NO.4
ANDROID TROJAN </a> MARKET EXPANDING QUICKLY
NEW FRAUD
SCHEMES
SMS banking
Transactions between
cards
Online banking transfers
Fake mobile banking
Interception of mobile
banking access
What causes explosive growth?
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>10. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#10">TREND NO.4
ANDROID TROJAN </a> MARKET IS EXPANDING QUICKLY
ADVANCED
TROJANS
Several infection stages
Protecting network
communications and
code
Fake web pages
Web injects
What causes explosive growth?
MORE EFFECTIVE
DISTRIBUTION
Contextual advertising “Partner” programs
Exploits
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>11. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#11">FORECAST
a BOOM in </a> banking Trojans targeting Android
Thefts from
companies
Trojans to be adjusted
to steal money from
legal entities
Covert infection
Specialized exploit kits for
Android will be released
Sophisticated
functionality
Advanced Trojans will enable
hackers to implement all
attack schemes that were
successfully performed on
PC.
Losses from attacks using
Android Trojans will
exceed damages from PC
Trojans – THE MOST
DANGEROUS THREAT
to BANKS
Mobile web injects
Services for writing injects
for mobile browsers will be
offered on underground
forums; Trojans will widely
support web injects
Increased
damage
Average loss will
increase due to
targeted attacks on
companies
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>12. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#12">ON PC
Active automated
manipulations
Passive </a> automated
manipulations
All new Trojans
support automated
manipulations
PHISHING
Bypassing SMS
verification using
dialog windows
ON ANDROID
Automated transfer via
SMS banking
Automated transfer
between cards
VISHING
Bypassing SMS
verification using IVR
TREND NO.5
COMPLETELY AUTOMATED FRAUD
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>13. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#13">FORECAST
AUTOMATED FRAUD
Automatic fraud </a> on
ANDROID
Criminals will attack both
companies and people
using web injects to
replace payment details.
ROBOT-BASED
VISHING
Automated vishing attacks
will be adjusted to bypass
SMS verification and will
become more popular
AUTOMATED
PHISHING
The function to bypass
SMS verification will make
mobile Trojans the most
dangerous threat to the
majority of banks.
With their wide distribution and automation
PHISHING and ANDROID Trojans will finally replace PC
Trojans.
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>14. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#14">TREND NO.6
IOT TRIGGERS </a> THE GROWTH OF
BOTNETS FOR DDOS ATTACKS
MOVE AWAY
AMPLIFIERS
DNS, NTP, SSDP,
CharGen and other types
are less actively used
BOTNETS
REAPPEAR
Criminals often use Linux
servers and simple IoT
devices to create botnets
SOURCE CODES
ARE PUBLISHED
Lizard Stresser and Mirai
were released publicly
Dynamic IP addresses
No antivirus installed
24-hours access to the Internet
IoT devices are perfect bots
Difficult to update and eliminate
known vulnerabilities
Passwords set by default
2015
450 Gbps
2016
602 Gbps
09.2016
1 Tbps
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>15. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#15">TREND NO.7
Ransomware – </a> snowballing threat
Key target – enterprises
Buy access to critical data
Check servers by guessing their
passwords
Encrypt Windows and Linux-based
servers
A wide variety of attacks
on mobile devices and IoT
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>16. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#16">FORECAST
INCREASE IN INCIDENTS </a> WITH RANSOMWARE
Wide variety of
targets
Mobile and IoT devices,
cloud storages
Average ransom will
increase
Newer ransomware versions
will deliberately target key
business assets, which will
significantly raise the price of
ransomware decryption keys
Pinpoint attack
The key target is companies
with critical business
processes, which cannot
spend time to recover them
and will pay ransoms
Worms
Ransomware will be
distributed as
cryptoworms to widely
spread threats and
cause significant
damage
Smoke Screens
Encrypting ransomware will
be used as a “distraction”
tool in conjunction with high-
profile targeted attacks, like
DDoS attacks used
previously
An increase in attacks will
stimulate the cyber risk
insurance segment, which in
turn will motivate criminals
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>17. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#17">TREND NO.8
Increase in </a> attacks
on critical infrastructure
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>18. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#18">THREATS AT
TELECOM
OPERATOR LEVEL
What </a> hackers need:
Access to SS7 Hub or
license for one of the
following paid services:
Defentek, Verint,
CleverSig, Circles,
Cobham
Using Android Trojans
TREND NO.9
NEW TOOLS FOR TARGETED ATTACKS
AND ESPIONAGE
What hackers obtain:
Access to all the
traffic
Ability to decrypt
SSL
Access to
credentials of
external systems
What hackers obtain:
Access to geo-location
Voice interception
SMS interception
Access to messengers,
photos, and files
Execution of USSD
commands
Password recovery
Access to a cloud storage
At provider level
What hackers need:
Access to a routing
gateway or their own
autonomous system
(AS)
What hackers obtain:
Access to geo-
location
Voice interception
SMS interception
Execution of USSD
commands
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>19. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#19">FORECAST
ATTACKS ON CRITICAL </a> INFRASTRUCTURE
Public
information
Information on
successful attacks will
leak to journalists
because of their
political subtext
Popularization
Public reaction to
successful attacks will
provoke increased interest
from cyber-armies and
terrorists
Cyber-armies
Cyber-armies will attack
critical infrastructure
facilities
Goal: espionage and
control capability
Terrorists
Cyber-terrorists will
target critical
infrastructure facilities
Goal: public attention,
human losses
ONLINE
RECRUITMENT
Cyber-terrorists will
actively use the Internet
for propagation and
recruitments of technical
specialists, who are able
to perform targeted
attacks
arrests
and recruitment
Hackers arrested for
targeted attacks on
companies will be
recruited by the
Government
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>20. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#20">Key findings
ATTACKS
TOOLS
Global operations </a> Various and stealthy
Automated thefts
IoT, Ransomware,
Spyware
Authors of PC Trojans
are of Russian origin
TARGETS
Banks Android
Critical infrastructure
Distribution of targeted attacks
&gt;&gt;&gt; Group-IB.COM
 </li></div><div><li>21. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#21">Prevention Response Investigation </a> Early Warning

Security Assessment

Emergency
Response Team

and Investigation

Financial and
Corporate
Investigation
Threat monitoring
and analysis
Threat Intelligence
Detection
of targeted attacks
TDS
TDS Polygon
Early fraud detection
Secure Bank
Secure Portal
GROUP-IB | Products &amp; Services
 </li></div><div><li>22. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/hitech-crime-trends-2016-73985957/73985957#22">INFRASTRUCTURE
Honeynet and botnet </a> analysis
Hacker community infiltration
Open-source monitoring
Network attack trackers
TDS Sensors
Behavior analysis system
HUMAN
INTELLIGENCE
Forensics
Investigations
Malware monitoring and
research
CERT-GIB request database
Security Assessment
Group-IB case studies
GLOBAL DATA
EXCHANGE
Computer incident response
teams
Domain registrar and hosting
providers
Cyber security vendors
Europol, Interpol
and law enforcement agencies
Key regions of monitoring: Russia, the CIS and Eastern Europe, Asia Pacific, Middle East
Profound human intelligence
and cutting-edge technologies

16:21:02 UTC","description":"The document reviews hi-tech crime trends from Q2 2015 to Q1 2016, focusing on the rise of targeted attacks on banks, the expansion of the Android trojan market, and the increasing threat of ransomware and attacks on critical infrastructure. It highlights key developments in the Russian cybercrime market, including the emergence of new trojans and sophisticated attack strategies leveraging social engineering. The report concludes with recommendations for prevention and response measures against these evolving cyber Crime Trends 2016","totalSlides":24,"transcript":["2015 Q2 –\n2016 Q1\nHI-TECH\nCRIME TRENDS\n2016\n ","Review of the Russian cybercrime market\nKey driver of growth – Targeted attacks\nChanges to previous period\n\u003e\u003e\u003e Group-IB.COM\n ","TREND No.1\nTARGETED ATTACKS ON BANKS AS A GLOBAL THREAT\n\u003e\u003e\u003e Group-IB.COM\n ","COBALT\nATMs and SWIFT\nTREND NO.2\nGROUPS REFOCUS FROM COMPANIES TO BANKS\nLURK\nCore Banking Systems\nCORKOW\nPOS terminals, ATMs,\ntrading terminals\nANUNAK\nCore Banking Systems,\nSWIFT, ATMs,\npayment gateways,\nPOS terminals\nBUHTRAP\nCore Banking Systems\nGROUP-IB.COM/REPORTS\nCURRENT\nsoon!\n\u003e\u003e\u003e Group-IB.COM\n ","FORECAST\nTARGETED ATTACKS ON BANKS\nCHANGE IN\nFOCUS\nActive groups\nspecializing in attacks\non companies will\nthreaten banks\nEXPANDING IN\nGEOGRAPHY\nHackers attacking Russian\nbanks will move their\nactivity to other regions\nworldwide\nBROADENING\nCOMPETENCIES\nGroups attacking ATMs will\nperform cyber thefts on\nSWIFT system\nPHISHING\nMAILOUTS\nThe key vector to infect\nbanking networks is\nphishing emails\nINVOLVING\nINSIDERS\nHackers devote more\ntime searching for\ninsiders (contacts,\napplication launch,\nconsulting on system\noperation)\nLEGITIMATE\nTOOLS\nCriminals choose\nlegitimate or free tools to\nperform attacks\nArrests of Russian-speaking hacker groups\nhave a significant impact on\nthe global landscape of banking threats\n\u003e\u003e\u003e Group-IB.COM\n ","TREND NO.3\nRussian-speaking PC Trojan\ndevelopers take over the world\nGLOBE\nPanda Banker (new)\nShifu (new)\nMidas bot (Jupiter) (new)\nGozNym (new)\nSphinx (new)\nCorebot (new)\nAtmos (new)\nGozi (ISFB)\nDridex\nQadars\nGootkit\nVawtrak\nTinba\nKINS (ZeusVM)\nCitadel\nZeus\nQuakbot (Qbot)\nRetefe\nRamnit\nRUSSIA\nBuhtrap\nToplel\nRanbyus\nRTM (new)\nJupiter (new)\nLurk\nCorkow\nYebot\nKronos\nChtonic\n16 of the 19 Trojans that have been actively used to\nattack companies are believed to be developed by\nRussian-speaking cybercriminals\n\u003e\u003e\u003e Group-IB.COM\n ","FORECAST\nRussian-speaking PC Trojan developers take\nover the world\nCONTRACTION OF\nTHE RUSSIAN\nMARKET\nThe amount of groups,\nTrojans and losses from\nattacks will continuously\ndecrease\nMOVEMENT TO\nNEW MARKETS\nNew Trojans designed\nto attack foreign banks\nwill be actively\ndeveloped\nHACKERS TO\nSELL ACTIVE\nBOTNETS\nSome active botnets will be\nsold to less-experienced\nperpetrators\nWEB INJECTS\nDevelopers will add web\ninjects to perform\nautomated attacks\nFAKE WEB PAGES\nFake web pages added to\nTrojans will enable hackers\nto expand the list of\nattacked countries\nSPAM MAILOUTS\nThe key infection vector\nfor banking Trojans\n\u003e\u003e\u003e Group-IB.COM\n ","TREND NO.4\nANDROID TROJAN MARKET IS EXPANDING QUICKLY\nEUROPE AND\nUSA\nMarcher 2.0 (new)\nXbot (new)\nAbrvall (new)\nAsacub (new)\nMbot 2.0 (new)\nT00rb00r (new)\nMarcher\nGM-bot\nSkunk\nBilal\nReich (Svpeng)\nRUSSIA\nGroup 404\nApiMaps\nAdabot\nCron1 (new)\nFlexNet (new)\nAgent.sx (new)\nAgent.BID (new)\nHonli (new)\nAsucub (new)\nFakeInst.ft (new)\nGM bot (new)\nFake Marcher (new)\nCron2 (new)\nGreff\nMarch\nWebmobil\nMikorta\nMobiApps\nXruss\nTark\nSizeprofit\n\u003e\u003e\u003e Group-IB.COM\n ","TREND NO.4\nANDROID TROJAN MARKET EXPANDING QUICKLY\nNEW FRAUD\nSCHEMES\nSMS banking\nTransactions between\ncards\nOnline banking transfers\nFake mobile banking\nInterception of mobile\nbanking access\nWhat causes explosive growth?\n\u003e\u003e\u003e Group-IB.COM\n ","TREND NO.4\nANDROID TROJAN MARKET IS EXPANDING QUICKLY\nADVANCED\nTROJANS\nSeveral infection stages\nProtecting network\ncommunications and\ncode\nFake web pages\nWeb injects\nWhat causes explosive growth?\nMORE EFFECTIVE\nDISTRIBUTION\nContextual advertising “Partner” programs\nExploits\n\u003e\u003e\u003e Group-IB.COM\n ","FORECAST\na BOOM in banking Trojans targeting Android\nThefts from\ncompanies\nTrojans to be adjusted\nto steal money from\nlegal entities\nCovert infection\nSpecialized exploit kits for\nAndroid will be released\nSophisticated\nfunctionality\nAdvanced Trojans will enable\nhackers to implement all\nattack schemes that were\nsuccessfully performed on\nPC.\nLosses from attacks using\nAndroid Trojans will\nexceed damages from PC\nTrojans – THE MOST\nDANGEROUS THREAT\nto BANKS\nMobile web injects\nServices for writing injects\nfor mobile browsers will be\noffered on underground\nforums; Trojans will widely\nsupport web injects\nIncreased\ndamage\nAverage loss will\nincrease due to\ntargeted attacks on\ncompanies\n\u003e\u003e\u003e Group-IB.COM\n ","ON PC\nActive automated\nmanipulations\nPassive automated\nmanipulations\nAll new Trojans\nsupport automated\nmanipulations\nPHISHING\nBypassing SMS\nverification using\ndialog windows\nON ANDROID\nAutomated transfer via\nSMS banking\nAutomated transfer\nbetween cards\nVISHING\nBypassing SMS\nverification using IVR\nTREND NO.5\nCOMPLETELY AUTOMATED FRAUD\n\u003e\u003e\u003e Group-IB.COM\n ","FORECAST\nAUTOMATED FRAUD\nAutomatic fraud on\nANDROID\nCriminals will attack both\ncompanies and people\nusing web injects to\nreplace payment details.\nROBOT-BASED\nVISHING\nAutomated vishing attacks\nwill be adjusted to bypass\nSMS verification and will\nbecome more popular\nAUTOMATED\nPHISHING\nThe function to bypass\nSMS verification will make\nmobile Trojans the most\ndangerous threat to the\nmajority of banks.\nWith their wide distribution and automation\nPHISHING and ANDROID Trojans will finally replace PC\nTrojans.\n\u003e\u003e\u003e Group-IB.COM\n ","TREND NO.6\nIOT TRIGGERS THE GROWTH OF\nBOTNETS FOR DDOS ATTACKS\nMOVE AWAY\nAMPLIFIERS\nDNS, NTP, SSDP,\nCharGen and other types\nare less actively used\nBOTNETS\nREAPPEAR\nCriminals often use Linux\nservers and simple IoT\ndevices to create botnets\nSOURCE CODES\nARE PUBLISHED\nLizard Stresser and Mirai\nwere released publicly\nDynamic IP addresses\nNo antivirus installed\n24-hours access to the Internet\nIoT
